properties.Program_Practice_Model_Notes: Youth Job Link is for youth who do not face significant barriers.  Youth with significant barriers are referred out to other employment programs such as Skills Link or Youth Job Connection.  Youth Job Link supports youth under 30 to find full or part time work while in school, or between semesters, or when they have left school completely.  We match youth to employer needs.  We can offer small incentives to employers and also small financial supports to clients.  We assess you based on their motivation to find work, and their service need.  Youth with lower motivation may benefit from a motivational interviewing appointment.

properties.Program_Issues_Addressed: The Youth Outreach program addresses the need to break the cycle of violence and abuse through early intervention.  Identifying young women who are living with abuse and/or at-risk of being victimized is a recognized strategy while targeting young men with the aim of engaging them as allies in a gender-based equality movement. Provide early interventions with young men and women to equip them with knowledge regarding gender based violence and strategies to manage challenges will result in better choices and positive futures.
properties.Program_Practice_Model_Notes: The Youth Outreach component of the program has been offered by Abrigo for the past 20 years in collaboration with the Toronto District School Board (TDSB) and the Toronto District Catholic School Board (TDCSB).  Through public education, this youth program supports the larger goal of having participants experience life and relationships that are free of violence and abuse and help build a supportive caring community that does not tolerate such actions.   Youth Outreach Objectives: - To provide youth with accurate information regarding community resources and how to seek support - To improve knowledge among youth regarding gender-based violence and abuse issues - To improve stress coping strategies  - To enhance youth leadership skills   Individual Youth Counselling Objectives: - To increase knowledge of abuse and impact on self - To develop a safety plan - Ensure access to information promoting informed decisions. - To improve self-esteem - Ensure that urgent needs are met - To access essential resources (such as housing, OW, substance abuse counselling) - To improve inter-familial relationships
properties.Program_Outcomes_Notes: At the conclusion of their involvement with the Youth Outreach component of the program, we want to see evidence that youth have gained new knowledge and skills.  Participant surveys are administered to measure the extent to which they report back on any new knowledge that they have acquired and whether they intend to put what they have learned into practice.  With Individual Counselling, outcomes are recorded when mutually agreed upon between Counsellor and youth.  In support of Abrigoâ€™s efforts to mitigate the effects of poverty, the following outcomes were tracked for the fiscal year as evidence this programâ€™s impact upon a total of 1,350 youth served:  100% surveyed reported having knowledge regarding where to seek help if and when needed 100% surveyed reported new knowledge regarding gender-based violence and abuse 72% surveyed reported improved stress coping strategies  36% surveyed reported enhanced leadership skills as a result of TAG-V outreach  84 youth reported understanding their options and making informed decisions through counselling  46 youth reported decreased social isolation as a result of counselling 77 youth reported making progress towards attaining their personal goals through counselling 76 youth reported increased coping strategy skills as a result of counselling
properties.Outcomes1: 2 - Ontario youth feel mentally healthy
properties.Program_Funder: City of Toronto & United Way

properties.Program_Issues_Addressed: Towards our goal of socially integrated and empowered individuals, we offer youth outreach to the schools providing workshops on topics related to dating violence and mental health and wellbeing as well as individual counselling. Our individual counselling services are for youth who are experiencing dating violence/gender violence/family violence/bullying/mental health and substance abuse issues.
properties.Program_Practice_Model_Notes: Practice model in a group setting at school can vary by topic and generally is interactive, and / or arts based. Individual counselling is generally based on the narrative therapy model, and can also incorporate CBT, and arts based approached depending on individual and their goals.
properties.Program_Outcomes_Notes: Our Youth Outreach in schools has the outcome to increase awareness and knowledge of gender based violence, in all its forms, and strategies and or resources for youth. Our individual counselling services is to increase safety for the client and discuss options and updating an action plan based upon their individual needs and goals.
